intro: Sisyrinchium heterocarpum, commonly known as the blue-eyed grass, is a member of the Iridaceae family and is native to the western United States. It is a low-growing perennial herb with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces delicate blue to purple flowers. The plant typically blooms in early spring and thrives in well-drained soils in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowering stems are usually less than 10 inches tall, and the flowers are clustered in inflorescences. Sisyrinchium heterocarpum is often found in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and rocky areas.
